Domain-specific language: [Appliance] Network-attached storage provides a file-level computer storage server connected to a computer network to a heterogenous group of clients. NAS is both storage and a file system.
[Test] Operational acceptance test: criteria are defined in terms of functional and non-functional requirements; covering key quality attributes of functional stability, portability and reliability.
[Network] Storage area network provides consolidated block-based storage and leaves file system concerns on the client" side."

[Mechanism] Time to live / hop limit: a mechanism that limits the lifespan or lifetime of data in a computer or network. TTL may be implemented as a counter or timestamp attached to or embedded in the data. Once the prescribed event count or timespan has elapsed, data is discarded. In computer networking, TTL prevents a data packet from circulating indefinitely. In computing applications, TTL is used to improve performance of caching or to improve privacy.
[Test] User acceptance test: high-level tests to verify the completeness of a user story or stories 'played' during any sprint/iteration.

[Appliance] Virtual desktop infrastructure is a virtualization technology that hosts a desktop operating system on a centralized server in a data center. Because the OS does not operate on the client machine, this model called a thin client" model."
